creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Mrs Irma Levin in memory of Dr A. Jess Shenson
description: three lines of looping calligraphy; signature LLC; sage colored mount with purple and gold inner border
inscription:
Signature, Seals, and Labels

The heavens still hide his sinuous form, / Like Mr. Ye trying to look for the dragon from his window. / The brushwork is marvelous, I can see beyond the silk and paper; / The clouds are dark, the mist gloomy at the moment of his thundering. (SA)
markings: URC, rectangular intaglio; LLC, two square intaglios; black vinyl label on R and L roller ends: [Kien]
title: Poem for a Dragon Painting
